results.title: Growth
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
A hand-cart and bicycle, then a delivery wagon and a horse - Sam Steinberg reminisces over the fifty years of his company’s growth into a large, diversified corporation. A company cannot stand still, it must go forward he claims. In this film you see the process continuing as corporation executives meet to consider interrelated operations, projects and priorities. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.

results.title: International operations
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Corporation”.
The arrival of Steinberg’s French affiliate, Supermarches Montreal, on the outskirts of Paris is viewed here from the point of its cultural effects: the impact of the supermarket on the shopping and eating habits of the French; and the problems of adjustment by store employees, by Paris shoppers, and by local merchants who see their customers drift away. As Sam Steinberg makes his first visit to the French stores, many of these problems are seen at first hand. Voice and narration by Arthur Hammond.

results.title: Contempt = Le Mepris
results.creator_credit: Jean-Luc Godard, Carlo Ponti, Georges de Beauregard, C C Champion (Rome), Concordia and Rome Paris Films
results.brief_description: When aspiring playwright Paul Javal (Michel Piccoli) is called in as script doctor on a film of The Odyssey, he is caught between a director (Fritz Lang) who wants to capture the reality of Homer’s world, and crass producer Prokosch (Jack Palance) who just wants more mermaids. As his artistic integrity gradually succumbs to the power of Prakosch’s chequebook, his wife Camille (Bardot) regards him with increasing contempt. This video includes the original cinema trailer.

results.title: Contact [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Steve Starkey and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The search for life outside our solar system becomes a personal and spiritual quest for Ellie Arroway, a scientist who has lost her faith in God after her parents died when she was a child. However, she has learned to develop a different sort of faith in the seemingly unknowable, working with a group that monitors radio waves from space in a hope that some day she will receive a message from another world- proving there is a world beyond our own. When the team picks up a signal that does not appear to be of earthly origin, Ellie decodes the message and discovers what appear to be plans for a space craft, which she takes as an invitation. Ellie and her researchers soon run into interference however from a White House scientific adviser who cuts their funding and tries to take credit for their achievements. Cast includes Jodie Foster, Matthew McConaughey, James Woods, John Hurt and Tom Skerritt.

results.title: Consumer power
results.creator_credit: Peita Bolden and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Four fifteen minute programs which follow Anna, Nick and skeleton Clive as they set up a toy shop and in the process learn to cope with the minefield of choices and responsibilities facing young consumers. An engaging and humourous story unfolds to assist 7-10 year olds in learning about consumer expectations, advertising, budgeting and consumer rights and responsibilities.

results.title: Corral
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The roping and riding of a high-spirited half-broken horse is the subject of a film which makes visual poetry of this theme. Movement and music combine to tel a story without words, set in the foothills of Alberta, as we watch a cowboy perform a task which is part of a centuries-old tradition of the West. The music, played on guitar, is an original score containing variations on Western Ballad. (Five awards, including Venice; Edinburgh)

results.title: Corps a Coeur = Body to Heart
results.brief_description:
Pierre is a garage mechanic in his mid-30s with a considerable taste for the ladies. It comes as something of a surprise when he falls passionately in love with Jeanne, a woman in her 50s. She is unmoved by his advances, and despite her sharp rebuffs, he persists. Her heart thaws when she learns she is suffering from an incurable and fatal disease.

Credits: Producer, Cecile Clairval ; director, Paul Vecchiali ; writer, Paul Vecchiali ; photography, Georges Strouve ; music, Gabriel Faure, Roland Vincent.
Cast: Nicolas Silberg, Helene Surgere, Christine Murillo, Madeleine Robinson, Myriam Mezieres.

results.title: Cornet at night
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Tells a haunting story of boyhood on a prairie homestead. The boy, sent to town to find a strong hired hand, returns with a cornet player creating a tense atmosphere at supper. Later while milking, the farmer listens to the cornet, and understands that the boy’s need for music is as great as his own need for adequate help in the fields. The cornet player does not stay, but the echo of his music continues through the years. Based on a story by Sinclair Ross. (Awards: New York)
